keyPolicies.policyDescription: Lib Dems back a Streatham stop to cut commuter journey times and reduce congestion and air pollution
An extra 1p on income tax will raise £6bn to save our NHS and help integrate social care.
Lib Dems pledge an extra £60.5m for Lambeth schools over 5 years, making sure school budgets rise with inflation each year

mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: Conservatives have removed the commitment to Crossrail2 from their manifesto this time. Labour’s candidate calls himself “a local boy” - he lives in Hammersmith!

issues.brexitEurope: Alex campaigned for Britain to remain in the EU. He will fight for the people to have the final say on the Tory Hard Brexit deal vs remaining a member of the EU.
issues.education: Lib Dems pledge an extra £60.5m for Lambeth schools over 5 years, making sure school budgets rise with inflation each year
issues.environment: Lib Dems back a Streatham stop to cut commuter journey times and reduce congestion and air pollution
issues.health: An extra 1p on income tax will raise £6bn to save our NHS and help integrate social care.

leaflet.personalStatement: Alex has lived in Streatham all his life. Elected as a Lambeth Councillor in 2010, he served 4 years including as Leader of the Opposition. He worked with residents to save Streatham’s Tate Library when Labour threatened it with closure. He led the Lib Dem campaign to keep running to Streatham.

politicalExperience.achievements: Served as Leader of the Opposition. Worked with residents to save Streatham’s Tate Library when Labour threatened it with closure.

images.caption: Alex Davies in front of buildings on a street in Streatham.
